title: Fix mobile number validation to accept 10-digit Indian format

requirements.text: Update the mobile number validation in AdmissionFormPage.tsx to accept exactly 10-digit Indian mobile numbers (e.g., 9450956184). The field must remain mandatory. The error message should read: 'कृपया 10 अंकों का वैध मोबाइल नंबर दर्ज करें' (e.g., example: 9450956184). Remove any Pakistani format (03001234567) validation logic.

quotes: Mob no. 10 ank wala ho.mandatory ho
कृपया वैध मोबाइल नंबर दर्ज करें (जैसे: 03001234567)

acceptanceCriteria: Entering a 10-digit Indian number like 9450956184 passes validation and does not show an error
Entering fewer or more than 10 digits shows the Hindi error message 'कृपया 10 अंकों का वैध मोबाइल नंबर दर्ज करें'
Leaving the mobile number field empty shows a required/mandatory error
The example hint in the error message shows an Indian format number (e.g., 9450956184), not a Pakistani format number
Form submits successfully when a valid 10-digit number is entered

requirements.text: Update the mobile number validation in backend/main.mo to accept exactly 10-digit Indian mobile numbers (digits only, no leading zero or country code required). Remove any validation that enforces Pakistani format (11 digits starting with 03).

quotes: Mob no. 10 ank wala ho.mandatory ho

acceptanceCriteria: Backend accepts a 10-digit number like 9450956184 as valid
Backend rejects numbers that are not exactly 10 digits
Backend rejects empty mobile number strings

constraints: Do not change any other form fields or validation rules
Keep the mobile number field mandatory (required)
All user-facing error messages must remain in Hindi
nonGoals: Adding support for international phone formats
Changing any other part of the admission form UI or backend logic
